text: I bet most of you will agree that crispy
smoky bacon is one of life's greatest
pleasures but nobody loves a spattered
up stovetop and when the bacon is kind
of curled up cooked unevenly and burnt
in some places well today I'm going to
show you a mess free way of preparing
your bacon and the bacon cooks evenly
and it's nice and crispy in the end and
that is the oven method of cooking bacon
so forget this here snack on it later
maybe but starting with a wire rack over
a rimmed baking sheet and do yourself a
favor and place some parchment paper
underneath that will help to keep the
cleanup nice and easy and I have in
front of me two different types of bacon
I have a thin cut version and a thick
cut version and really it's up to you
whatever you prefer if you like
something that has a little bit more
bite to it than I would say go with a
thicker cut bacon if you like that thin
and crispy bacon that you get in the
diners then go for the thin cut bacon
today I'm going to use the thick cut and
all you have to do is place your bacon
on the wire rack pre-heat your oven to
400 degrees and what's really great
about this method is you can do a lot of
bacon so if you're hosting a brunch or a
big breakfast what I would recommend is
you put your racks in the lower third of
the oven and the upper third so that you
can fit in multiple trays just arrange
your bacon so it's evenly spaced make
sure you don't overlap the pieces so
that they cook nice and evenly and this
goes into the oven 400 degrees for about
15 to 18 minutes until the bacon is
nicely browned and it's super crisp into
the oven so our bacon is out of the oven
you can see it's really nice and brown
it's cooked perfectly
there aren't any burnt pieces burnt
sections of the bacon and there are no
flabby ends put the baked back in bacon
and give this method a try for perfectly
cooked bacon each and every time enjoy
you
